conversation.text: good morning what brings you in today

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: hello doctor i've been feeling uncomfortable lately i've noticed that i have to urinate more frequently than usual and is quite painful each time also the urine seems to be cloudy and has a strong odor

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: i'm sorry to hear that you're not feeling well any other symptoms you've noticed

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: yes i've also been feeling feverish and i've been experiencing lower abdominal pain

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: how long have you been experiencing these symptoms

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: alright do you have any allergies

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: no not that i am aware of

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: oak let me conduct a physical exam and then we'll take a urine sample for testing your vitals are stable but the lower abdomen seems tender we'll need to send you a urine sample for testing to confirm but your symptoms suggest a urinary tract infection

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: oh no is it serious doctor

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: it's quite common especially in women it's usually caused by bacteria entering the urinary tract if left untreated it can lead to more serious complications but with early treatment you should be fine i'll prescribe an antibiotic called nitrofurantoin which should help clear the infection it's important to finish the whole course of antibiotics even if you start feeling better

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: also drink plenty of water to help flush out bacteria avoid coffee alcohol and spicy foods as they can irritate your bladder
